participant_1.background:
I read a poem or two to get my creative juices flowing before starting my day.
I am a stay at home mom because my depression and anxiety makes it difficult for me to work outside the home.
I ride my scooter down the boardwalk until the wind blows away my worries.
I tried my hand at gambling, but I didn't have the stomach for it.
I paint my nails in different colors to match my outfits.

participant_2.background:
My friends would be impressed by my ability to make delicious food despite being broke.
I eat fruits like apples and bananas for their natural sweetness.
i am close to my mother , but not to my father.
i have three sisters.
I love spending time with my family, especially taking my son to the zoo to see koalas.

content.text: What's up? I'm trying to calm my anxiety down. I feel like I'm going to puke.
Hey there! I'm sorry to hear that. I know how you feel. Anxiety can be a real pain in the neck. What are you doing to try to calm down?
I'm reading a poem. I like to read poetry to get my creative juices flowing.
That's a great idea! I love reading poetry too. It can be so calming and inspiring. What kind of poetry do you like to read?
I like to read all kinds of poetry, but I especially like reading poems about nature. They always make me feel peaceful.
I love nature poems too! They're so beautiful and relaxing.
Me too! Do you have any favorite nature poems?
Yes, I love "The Road Not Taken" by Robert Frost. It's a beautiful poem about choosing a path in life.
I love that poem too! It's so meaningful.
It is. It's one of my favorite poems.
Me too! Thanks for talking to me. I feel a lot better now.
You're welcome! I'm glad I could help.
